DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation._A group of nearly parallel rays of electromagnetic radiation or a stream of particles._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.:A group of nearly parallel rays of electromagnetic radiation or a stream of particles.

Concepts.definition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.
A group of nearly parallel rays of electromagnetic radiation or a stream of particles.

Property.preferredDefinition: A subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

DataElementConcept.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: CS: A string of characters with leading or trailing spaces being non-significant consisting of Upper Case, 0-9, SPACE, Underscore. [Standard-based]_A group of nearly parallel rays of electromagnetic radiation or a stream of particles._The act or process of changing position or place; the change in position of a body part._The distinguishing qualities or prominent aspect of a person, object, action, process, or substance._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: One or more Control Point Sequence (300A,0111) attributes change between one or more consecutive pairs of control points with changing Cumulative Meterset Weight (300A,0134).
All Control Point Sequence (300A,0111) attributes remain unchanged between consecutive pairs of control points with changing Cumulative Meterset Weight (300A,0134).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A group of nearly parallel rays of electromagnetic radiation or a stream of particles.:The act or process of changing position or place; the change in position of a body part.:Characteristics; distinguishing qualities of a person, object, or substance.:Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

Concepts.definition: A group of nearly parallel rays of electromagnetic radiation or a stream of particles.
The act or process of changing position or place; the change in position of a body part.
The distinguishing qualities or prominent aspect of a person, object, action, process, or substance.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
